current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide for additional disclosure
			 requirements for corporations, labor organizations, Super PACs and other
			 entities, and for other purposes.

header.#text:
Disclosure
			 requirements for corporations, labor organizations, and certain other
			 entities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 324 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971

header.#text:
Disclosure of
				campaign-related disbursements by covered organizations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
made
			 under penalty
				of perjury that contains the information described in

text.#text:
Any covered
				organization that makes campaign-related disbursements aggregating
			 more than
				$10,000 in an election reporting cycle shall, not later than 24
			 hours after
				each disclosure date, file a statement with the

in the case of the first statement filed
				under this subsection, for the period beginning on the first day of
			 the
				election reporting cycle and ending on the first such disclosure
			 date;
				and

in the case of any
				subsequent statement filed under this subsection, for the period
			 beginning on
				the previous disclosure date and ending on such disclosure date.

The information described in this paragraph is as
				follows:

The name of the
				covered organization and the principal place of business of such
				organization.

The amount of each
				campaign-related disbursement made by such organization during the
			 period
				covered by the statement of more than $1,000, and the name and
			 address of the
				person to whom the disbursement was made.

In the case of a
				campaign-related disbursement that is not a covered transfer, the
			 election to
				which the campaign-related disbursement pertains and if the
			 disbursement is
				made for a public communication, the name of any candidate
			 identified in such
				communication and whether such communication is in support of or in
			 opposition
				to a candidate.

A certification by
				the chief executive officer or person who is the head of the
			 covered
				organization that the campaign-related disbursement is not made in
			 cooperation,
				consultation, or concert with or at the request or suggestion of a
			 candidate,
				authorized committee, or agent of a candidate, political party, or
			 agent of a
				political party.

continuation-text.#text:
but
				only if such payment was made by a person who made payments to the
			 account in
				an aggregate amount of $10,000 or more during the period beginning
			 on the first
				day of the election reporting cycle and ending on the disclosure
			 date.

quote.#tail: before the period at the end.

text.#text:
If any provision of this Act or amendment
			 made by this Act, or the application of a provision or amendment to any
			 person
			 or circumstance, is held to be unconstitutional, the remainder of this Act
			 and
			 amendments made by this Act, and the application of the provisions and
			 amendment to any person or circumstance, shall not be affected by the
			 holding.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect
			 to
			 disbursements made on or after January 1, 2015, and shall take effect
			 without
			 regard to whether or not the
